metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29922 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
library/std/src/net/parser.rs in Rust before 1.53.0 does not properlyconsider extraneous zero characters at the beginning of an IP addressstring, which (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass accesscontrol that is based on IP addresses, because of unexpected octalinterpretation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.53 - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-all - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-clippy - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-gdb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-lldb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-src - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rustc - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rustfmt - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1').
